creator: siffemoz

content:
There are many ways to undo a delete or move a deleted message back to eg: Inbox or any desired folder.

If you click on Delete and immediately notice that was wrong or notice reasonably quickly then you can do the following: Using the 'Menu Bar' toolbar

  • Edit > select 'Undo Delete Message' OR use keyboard: 'Ctrl+Z'

Any email in 'Delete' /'Trash' can be moved back to Inbox using the drag and drop method.

  • Left click and hold down on email in 'Trash' to grab it.
  • Then drag cursor to hover over the 'Inbox'
  • finally, release the mouse to drop into 'Inbox'

You can also choose to use the Menu Bar to move messages if you use the keyboard or find right clicking not so easy. Select email you want to move. Using the 'Menu Bar' toolbar

  • 'Message' > 'Move to' > select account > select folder eg: Inbox

Or via the keyboard: 'Alt+M' then press 'M' then use arrow keys to navigate to account and then navigate to desired folder - click on 'Enter' key to select that folder.

OR use the right click drop down context menu - as Ed stated: Right click on email and select 'Move to' and choose account and folder.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
I have a weird similar (?) problem with deleted messages. I'm using IMAP and the TB-DeletedItems is pointing to the IMAP-equivalent.

When I Move messages out of the TB-DeletedItems into the Inbox, after a second they are back into the TB-DeletedItems.

Even worse, when I Copy the messages into the Inbox, again, after a second they are (next to the original message) into the TB-DeletedItems. So now they are twice in TB-DeletedItems

The same happens when I copy the messages into another folder.

I can't find a way to have those Messages back in the Inbox I don't understand what's going on. If I recall well, in the past I didn't have this issue.

UPDATE:

I did a test with another IMAP-server, there the problem does NOT exist. Means this that somehow is related to a deletion flag, considered by one IMAP-server and not by the other one.
creator: wquatan

Maybe the Inbox has some index corruption or not synchronising with server - so anything you try to put in Inbox is not working. Or maybe the Trash folder has a problem, so try the following on both.

Repair folder to force Index file to align correctly with mbox file.

  • Right click on eg: 'Inbox' folder and select 'Properties'
  • click on 'Repair Folder' button
  • click on 'OK'

Check all imap folders are correctly subscribed and synchronising with server.

  • Right click on imap account name in Folder Pane and select 'Subscribe'
  • Click on 'Refresh'
  • Select all required folders and click on 'Subscribe'
  • Click on 'OK'
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Did you activate the "Quick Filter" toolbar in your Inbox folder?
creator: Mapenzi

content:
If you have enabled a filter on the Inbox then it can alter the display. check you have the following set up. Via the 'Menu Bar' toolbar

  • 'View' > 'Folders' > only select 'All folders'
  • 'View' > 'Threads' > only select 'All'

If you see any of the 'icons' displaying a coloured strip in the 'Quick Filter' toolbar ? It might be the 'pin' icon or any of the others which has applied a filter set on another folder. If yes, then click on the icon to remove that filter and it also removes the highlight.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Not seeing new mail may mean another problem. You would need to logon to the webmail account via a browser and find out if new mail has actually been received into webmail account. If you have no new mail on server then check - have you used up your server quota. Basically, if you have used up all the allowed server space and it's full, the server cannot receive any new mail until you have created some space by deleteing old mail off server. Any emails sent to you get returned to sender as undeliverable.

If you use IMAP accounts in Thunderbird then you would need to get a 'Copy' of important mail into the 'Local Folders' account before you delete off the server because Imap accounts can only display whatever is on the server.

If you use Google then please note server quota is not just emails, it also includes calendar and Google photos.

If you use POP and gmail: Gmail can get to be a pain when it comes to Pop accounts because they cannot put deleted mail into the server Trash folder. That means everything is still in the 'All Mail' fodler on server. So gmail ends up slowly restricting what can be downloaded thus forcing you to logon to webmail account, access 'All Mail' folder and delete a load of emails off the server. Then downloads will commence again.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Hernan Fonda said
Good afternoon, I have two accounts set up through Thunderbird, hfonda@moscuzza.com and buques@moscuzza.com I read both on my notebook and on my mobile phone, but they are not synchronised. In other words, if, for example, I create a subfolder on my computer, I cannot see it on my phone, and vice versa. Is it possible to synchronise the account on all devices? Thank you very much. I look forward to your reply. Kind regards, Hernan Fonda

If the accounts are set up as POP, synchronization is not possible - they must be IMAP on all devices.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Convert_a_POP_account_to_a_IMAP_account

creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content:
In addition to previous comment... There has been an update on what the online/offline button looks like, but it is still in the same location - bottom left in Status bar.

In Thunderbird Look bottom left in the Status Bar There will be an icon that look like it has a red slash across it - that means you are in 'Offline' mode. Click on that icon and it should go to Online mode and look like a small circle with radiating semi circles. But you do need your computer to be connected to the internet :)

If you start up Thunderbird and it does not detect internet connectivity then it will open in offine mode.

It's worth checking your settings: In Thunderbird

  • Settings > General
  • scroll down to 'Network & Disc Space' section
  • click on 'Offline' button to see current setup.

I use 'Automatically follow detected online state' Send unsent messages when going online 'Ask me' Download messages for offline use.....'yes'
creator: Toad-Hall

content: futtleqwip - lucky you with all those toolbars. The composition toolbar isn't an option offered to me, View-Toolbars offers Menu Bar, Quick Filter Bar, Spaces Toolbar and Status Bar. I am on v143. I have re-installed, I have tried troubleshoot mode. Nothing works GRRR
creator: jools1

content:
jools1 said
futtleqwip - lucky you with all those toolbars. The composition toolbar isn't an option offered to me, View-Toolbars offers Menu Bar, Quick Filter Bar, Spaces Toolbar and Status Bar. I am on v143. I have re-installed, I have tried troubleshoot mode. Nothing works GRRR

You are looking in the wrong location - the method you mention means you are viewing the main Thunderbird window showing Folder Pane etc. The 'Composition' toolbar is only seen in the 'Write' compose message window because that's where it's required.


Open a new Write message window. Assuming you can see the 'File Edit View toolbar at the top....

  • Select 'View' > 'Toolbars' > select 'Composition Toolbar'

If you cannot see the top File View Edit...toolbar in Write window - press 'Alt' key

  • Then Select 'View' > 'Toolbars' > select 'Menu Bar'
  • Select 'View' > 'Toolbars' > select 'Composition Toolbar'

Now both toolbars should be visible and so should the 'Send' button.
creator: Toad-Hall
